meanings.definition: To affirm or assert (something) about the subject of a sentence.
meanings.sent1: She is predicating her argument on solid evidence.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is predicating the importance of studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: By predicating her claim on facts, she convinced everyone.
meanings.sent4: His success is predicating on hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: Predicating your decisions on emotions can lead to mistakes.

meanings.definition: To base or found (something) on or upon.
meanings.sent1: The company is predicating its expansion plans on market research.
meanings.sent2: They are predicating their argument on historical data.
meanings.sent3: Predicating the project on teamwork ensured its success.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness is predicating on her family's well-being.
meanings.sent5: Predicating your dreams on hard work can make them come true.
